expectedResults.title: Path Traversal Vulnerability
expectedResults.reason: Expected path traversal vulnerability in index.html (lines 1-108) was not identified in the actual penetration test results. The test results focus on HTTP security headers and server information disclosure but do not address directory traversal attack vectors in the application code.

expectedResults.title: Local File Inclusion (LFI)
expectedResults.reason: Expected LFI vulnerability in index.html (lines 1-108) was not identified in the actual penetration test results. The test did not examine file inclusion parameters or related input validation issues that could allow inclusion of local system files.

actualResults.title: Missing Content-Security-Policy (CSP) Header - XSS Protection Not Implemented
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - CSP headers are a critical defense-in-depth mechanism against XSS attacks. While not addressing the expected path traversal/LFI vulnerabilities, this represents a genuine security weakness that increases application risk.

actualResults.title: Missing X-Frame-Options Header - Clickjacking Vulnerability
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - The absence of X-Frame-Options header leaves the application vulnerable to clickjacking attacks. This is a legitimate vulnerability that was discovered but not in the expected findings.

actualResults.title: Missing X-Content-Type-Options Header - MIME Sniffing Vulnerability
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Missing X-Content-Type-Options header can lead to MIME sniffing attacks and potential XSS exploitation. This represents a real security gap in the application's defense mechanisms.

actualResults.title: HTTP Server Information Disclosure - Version Details in Server Header
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Exposing SimpleHTTP/0.6 and Python/3.13.3 version information enables attackers to identify and exploit known vulnerabilities. This information disclosure supports reconnaissance activities.

actualResults.title: Missing X-XSS-Protection Header - Legacy XSS Protection Not Enabled
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - While a legacy mechanism, the absence of X-XSS-Protection header reduces protection for users on older browsers. Minor impact in modern environments but represents defense-in-depth gap.

actualResults.title: Unsupported HTTP Methods Return Information Disclosure
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - The server returns verbose 501 errors with specific method names instead of generic 405 responses, enabling HTTP method enumeration and reconnaissance.

actualResults.title: Last-Modified Header Disclosure - File Timestamp Information Leakage
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Exposing file modification timestamps can help attackers correlate changes with known vulnerability disclosures and understand application update patterns.

missed.title: Path Traversal Vulnerability
missed.reason: Expected path traversal vulnerability in index.html (lines 1-108) was not identified in the actual penetration test results. The test results focus on HTTP security headers and server information disclosure but do not address directory traversal attack vectors in the application code.
